ilog.cplex

Class IloCplex.Callback.Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • ilog.cplex.IloCplex.Callback.Context
  • Enclosing class:
    IloCplex.Callback

    public abstract static class IloCplex.Callback.Context
extends java.lang.Object
    Context for the CPLEX callback. Instances of this class describe the context in which the CPLEX callback can be invoked.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id
      Places in which a CPLEX callback can be invoked.
      static class  IloCplex.Callback.Context.Info
      Constants to query information from a CPLEX callback.
      static class  IloCplex.Callback.Context.SolutionStrategy
      Identifiers for the different strategies that can be passed to postHeuristicSolution(ilog.concert.IloNumVar[], double[], int, int, double, ilog.cplex.IloCplex.Callback.Context.SolutionStrategy).

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public abstract long getId()
        Gets the context in which the corresponding callback was invoked.
        Returns:
        A value from IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id that specifies the context in which this instance was invoked.

      • inThreadUp

        public final boolean inThreadUp()
        Tests whether the callback was invoked in context Id.ThreadUp. It is a shortcut for getId() == IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.ThreadUp

        Returns:
        true if the callback was invoked in context Id.ThreadUp and false otherwise.

      • inThreadDown

        public final boolean inThreadDown()
        Tests whether the callback was invoked in context Id.ThreadDown. It is a shortcut for getId() == IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.ThreadDown

        Returns:
        true if the callback was invoked in context Id.ThreadDown and false otherwise.

      • inLocalProgress

        public final boolean inLocalProgress()
        Tests whether the callback was invoked in context Id.LocalProgres. It is a shortcut for getId() == IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.LocalProgress

        Returns:
        true if the callback was invoked in context Id.LocalProgress and false otherwise.

      • inGlobalProgress

        public final boolean inGlobalProgress()
        Tests whether the callback was invoked in context Id.GlobalProgress. It is a shortcut for getId() == IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.GlobalProgress

        Returns:
        true if the callback was invoked in context Id.GlobalProgress and false otherwise.

      • inCandidate

        public final boolean inCandidate()
        Tests whether the callback was invoked in context Id.Candidate. It is a shortcut for getId() == IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Candidate

        Returns:
        true if the callback was invoked in context Id.Feasible and false otherwise.

      • inRelaxation

        public final boolean inRelaxation()
        Tests whether the callback was invoked in context Id.Relaxation. It is a shortcut for getId() == IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Relaxation

        Returns:
        true if the callback was invoked in context Id.Relaxation and false otherwise.

      • getCplex

        public abstract IloCplex getCplex()
        Get the IloCplex instance currently running this callback.

        The returned IloCplex object can be used, for example, to create new constraints that cut off candidate solutions in rejectCandidate(ilog.concert.IloRange[]).

        Important: Do not use anything other than the factory methods of the returned IloCplex object. In particular, do not modify this instance. Doing so is unsupported and results in undefined behavior.

      • abort

        public abstract void abort()
                    throws IloException
        Stops optimization.

        This method instructs CPLEX to stop optimization as soon as possible after the callback returns.

        Throws:
        IloException

      • getIntInfo

        public abstract int getIntInfo(IloCplex.Callback.Context.Info what)
                        throws IloException
        Gets 32-bit signed, integer-valued information.

        See the documentation of IloCplex.Callback.Context.Info for details about information that can be queried.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        what - The information to be queried.
        Returns:
        The requested information.

      • postHeuristicSolution

        public abstract void postHeuristicSolution(IloNumVar[] vars,
                         double[] vals,
                         int start,
                         int length,
                         double obj,
                         IloCplex.Callback.Context.SolutionStrategy strategy)
                                    throws IloException
        Posts a (heuristic) solution to CPLEX.

        This method posts a solution vector to CPLEX. The vector is queued internally. The next time CPLEX plans to invoke a heuristic, CPLEX looks at the queue and attempts to create feasible solution from each vector. This procedure can result in new incumbent solutions.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        vars - Variables that constitute the solution to be posted.
        vals - Values for variables in vars.
        start - Index of first variable in vars and vals that constitutes the solution.
        length - Number of variables in vars and vals that constitute the solution.
        obj - (Estimated) objective value for the new solution.
        strategy - Strategy for completing partial solutions.

      • isCandidatePoint

        public abstract boolean isCandidatePoint()
                                  throws IloException
        Tests if callback is invoked for a finite solution.

        This method can be invoked only from IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Candidate; it throws an exception when invoked from another context.

        If the method returns true then the candidate feasible point can be examined using getCandidatePoint(ilog.concert.IloNumVar[], int, int), getCandidateValue(ilog.concert.IloNumExpr), and getCandidateObjective().

        Throws:
        IloException
        Returns:
        true if the callback was invoked for a candidate feasible point.

      • getCandidatePoint

        public abstract double[] getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar[] vars,
                         int start,
                         int length)
                                    throws IloException
        Gets the candidate solution.

        This method retrieves the values for vars[start], ..., vars[start+length-1] in the current candidate and returns them.

        This method can be invoked only from IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Candidate and if IloCplex.Callback.Context.isCandidatePoint() returns true; it throws an exception when invoked from another context.

        Throws:
        IloException - if any error occurs during the query.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which values are to be queried.
        start - First variable to query in vars.
        length - Number of variables to query from vars.
        Returns:
        An array with a value for each variable in vars[start], . . . , vars[start+length-1]. The first value in this array is for vars[start] and so on.

      • isCandidateRay

        public abstract boolean isCandidateRay()
                                throws IloException
        Tests if callback is invoked for an unbounded relaxation.

        This method can be invoked only from IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Candidate; it throws an exception when invoked from another context.

        If the method returns true then the unbounded ray can be obtained using getCandidateRay().

        Throws:
        IloException
        Returns:
        true if the callback was invoked for an unbounded relaxation.

      • getCandidateRay

        public abstract IloLinearNumExpr getCandidateRay()
                                          throws IloException
        Gets the unbounded ray for IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Candidate.

        This method returns the unbounded ray as a sparse expression.

        This method can be invoked only from IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Candidate and if IloCplex.Callback.Context.isCandidateRay() returns true; it throws an exception when invoked from another context.

        Throws:
        IloException - if any error occurs during the query.
        Returns:
        An expression representing the ray. Every non-zero coefficient in the ray has the respective non-zero coefficient in the return expression.

      • getCandidatePoint

        public double[] getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar[] vars)
                           throws IloException
        Gets the candidate solution.

        This method is a convenience wrapper for getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar[],int,int). See the reference documentation of that method for further details.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if vars or any of its elements is null.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which to query the candidate solution.
        Returns:
        The values for the variables in vars in the candidate solution.
        See Also:
        getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar[],int,int)

      • getCandidatePoint

        public double getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar var)
                         throws IloException
        Gets the candidate solution.

        This method is a convenience wrapper for getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar[],int,int). See the reference documentation of that method for further details.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        var - The variable for which to query the candidate solution.
        Returns:
        The value for var in the candidate solution.
        See Also:
        getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar[],int,int)

      • getCandidateValue

        public abstract double getCandidateValue(IloNumExpr expr)
                                  throws IloException
        Evaluates expr with respect to the current candidate solution.

        This method can be invoked only in the context IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Candidate and if IloCplex.Callback.Context.isCandidatePoint() returns true.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if expr is null.
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression to evaluate.
        Returns:
        the value of expr with respect to the current candidate solution.

      • getCandidateObjective

        public abstract double getCandidateObjective()
                                      throws IloException
        Gets the objective of the current candidate solution.

        This method can be invoked only from the context IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Candidate and if IloCplex.Callback.Context.isCandidatePoint() returns true; it throws an exception when invoked from another context.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Returns:
        The objective value of the current candidate solution.

      • rejectCandidate

        public abstract void rejectCandidate(IloRange[] violated)
                              throws IloException
        Rejects the current candidate solution.

        This method can be invoked only from IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Candidate and if IloCplex.Callback.Context.isCandidatePoint() returns true; it throws an exception when invoked from another context.

        The argument of this method consists of a set of constraints that CPLEX treats as lazy constraints.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the elements in violated is null.
        Parameters:
        violated - A set of constraints that cut off the candidate solution. This set can potentially be empty. This argument can also be null. If not null and not empty, then CPLEX can use these constraints to cut off further candidate solutions that CPLEX finds. (There is no guarantee that CPLEX does so, though.)

      • rejectCandidate

        public void rejectCandidate(IloRange violated)
                     throws IloException
        Rejects the current candidate solution.

        This method is a convenience wrapper for rejectCandidate(IloRange[]).

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        violated - A constraint that cuts of the candidate solution. This argument can be null.
        See Also:
        rejectCandidate(IloRange[])

      • getRelaxationPoint

        public abstract double[] getRelaxationPoint(IloNumVar[] vars,
                          int start,
                          int length)
                                     throws IloException
        Gets the current relaxation.

        This method retrieves the values for vars[start], . . . , vars[start+length-1] in the current relaxation, and returns them.

        This method can be invoked only from IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Relaxation; it throws an exception when invoked from another context.

        Throws:
        IloException - if any error occurs during the query.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which relaxation values are to be queried.
        start - First variable to query in vars.
        length - Number of variables to query from vars.
        Returns:
        An array with a value for each variable in vars[start], . . . , vars[start+length-1]. The first value in this array is for vars[start] and so on.

      • getRelaxationPoint

        public double[] getRelaxationPoint(IloNumVar[] vars)
                            throws IloException
        Gets the current relaxation.

        This method is a convenience wrapper for getRelaxationPoint(IloNumVar[],int,int). See the reference documentation of that method for further details.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if vars or any of its elements is null.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The values for the variables in vars in the current relaxation.
        See Also:
        getRelaxationPoint(IloNumVar[],int,int)

        public abstract double getRelaxationValue(IloNumExpr expr)

        Evaluates expr with respect to the current relaxation.

        This method can be invoked only in the context IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Relaxation.

        Throws:

      • getRelaxationObjective

        public abstract double getRelaxationObjective()
                                       throws IloException
        Gets the objective of the current relaxation.

        This method can be invoked only from IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Relaxation; it will throw an exception when invoked from another context.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Returns:
        The objective value of the current relaxation.

      • getIncumbent

        public abstract double[] getIncumbent(IloNumVar[] vars,
                    int start,
                    int length)
                               throws IloException
        Gets the current incumbent solution.

        This method retrieves the values for vars[start], . . . , vars[start+length-1] in the current incumbent solution and returns them. The method raises an exception if there is no incumbent solution available. Use getIntInfo(Info) and IloCplex.Callback.Context.Info.Feasible to check whether an incumbent is available.

        Throws:
        IloException - if any error occurs during the query.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which incumbent values are to be queried.
        start - First variable to query in vars.
        length - Number of variables to query from vars.
        Returns:
        An array with a value for each variable in vars[start], . . . , vars[start+length-1]. The first value in this array is for vars[start] and so on.

      • getIncumbent

        public double[] getIncumbent(IloNumVar[] vars)
                      throws IloException
        Gets the current incumbent solution.

        This method is a convenience wrapper for getIncumbent(IloNumVar[],int,int). See the reference documentation of that method for further details.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if vars or any of its elements is null.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which to query the current incumbent solution.
        Returns:
        The values for the variables in vars in the current incumbent solution.
        See Also:
        getIncumbent(IloNumVar[],int,int)

      • getIncumbentValue

        public abstract double getIncumbentValue(IloNumExpr expr)
                                  throws IloException
        Evaluates expr with respect to the current incumbent solution.
        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if expr is null.
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression to evaluate.
        Returns:
        The value of expr with respect to the current incumbent solution.

      • getIncumbentObjective

        public abstract double getIncumbentObjective()
                                      throws IloException
        Gets the objective value for the current incumbent.
        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Returns:
        The objective for the current incumbent. If currently there is no incumbent, the return value can be infinite (represented by a value such as 1e75).

      • getLocalLB

        public abstract double[] getLocalLB(IloNumVar[] vars,
                  int start,
                  int length)
                             throws IloException
        Gets the local lower bounds for variables.

        This methods queries the local bounds that were in place when the current relaxation was computed. These bounds may be tighter than global bounds due to presolve, branching, and other computations.

        This method can be invoked only from IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Relaxation; it will throw an exception when invoked from another context.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which lower bounds will be queried.
        start - Index of first variable in vars for which lower bound will be queried.
        length - Number of variables in vars for which lower bounds will be queried.
        Returns:
        The lower bounds for variables vars[start], . . . , vars[start + length - 1].

      • getLocalLB

        public double[] getLocalLB(IloNumVar[] vars)
                    throws IloException
        Gets the local lower bounds for an array of variables.

        This method is a convenience wrapper for getLocalLB(IloNumVar[],int,int). See the reference documentation of that method for further details.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if vars or any of its elements is null.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which to query the local bounds.
        Returns:
        The local bounds for the variables in vars.
        See Also:
        getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar[],int,int)

      • getLocalLB

        public double getLocalLB(IloNumVar var)
                  throws IloException
        Gets the local lower bound for a variable.

        Throws:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The bound for var.
        See Also:

      • getLocalUB

        public abstract double[] getLocalUB(IloNumVar[] vars,
                  int start,
                  int length)
                             throws IloException
        Gets the local upper bounds for variables.

        This method queries the local bounds that were in place when the current relaxation was computed. These bounds can be tighter than global bounds due to presolve, branching, and other computations.

        This method can be invoked only from the context IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.Relaxation; it will throw an exception when invoked from another context.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which upper bounds will be queried.
        start - Index of first variable in vars for which upper bound will be queried.
        length - Number of variables in vars for which upper bounds will be queried.
        Returns:
        The upper bounds for variables vars[start], . . . , vars[start + length - 1].

      • getLocalUB

        public double[] getLocalUB(IloNumVar[] vars)
                    throws IloException

        Throws:

        java.lang.NullPointerException - if vars or any of its elements is null.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        See Also:
        getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar[],int,int)

      • getGlobalLB

        public abstract double[] getGlobalLB(IloNumVar[] vars,
                   int start,
                   int length)
                              throws IloException
        Gets the global lower bounds for variables.

        This methods queries the best known globally valid bounds.

        This method cannot be invoked from IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.ThreadUp or IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.ThreadDown.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which upper bounds will be queried.
        start - Index of first variable in vars for which lower bound will be queried.
        length - Number of variables in vars for which lower bounds will be queried.
        Returns:
        The lower bounds for variables vars[start], . . . , vars[start + length - 1].

      • getGlobalLB

        public double[] getGlobalLB(IloNumVar[] vars)
                     throws IloException
        Gets the global lower bounds for an array of variables.

        This method is a convenience wrapper for getGlobalLB(IloNumVar[],int,int). See the reference documentation of that method for further details.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if vars or any of its elements is null.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which to query the global bounds.
        Returns:
        The global bounds for the variables in vars.
        See Also:
        getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar[],int,int)

      • getGlobalLB

        public double getGlobalLB(IloNumVar var)
                   throws IloException
        Gets the global lower bound for a variable.

        This method is a convenience wrapper for getGlobalLB(IloNumVar[],int,int). See the reference documentation of that method for further details.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        var - The variable for which to query the bound.
        Returns:
        The bound for var.
        See Also:
        getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar[],int,int)

      • getGlobalUB

        public abstract double[] getGlobalUB(IloNumVar[] vars,
                   int start,
                   int length)
                              throws IloException
        Gets the global upper bounds for variables.

        This method queries the best known globally valid bounds.

        This method cannot be invoked from IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.ThreadUp or IloCplex.Callback.Context.Id.ThreadDown.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which upper bounds will be queried.
        start - Index of first variable in vars for which upper bound will be queried.
        length - Number of variables in vars for which upper bounds will be queried.
        Returns:
        The upper bounds for variables vars[start], . . . , vars[start + length - 1].

      • getGlobalUB

        public double[] getGlobalUB(IloNumVar[] vars)
                     throws IloException
        Gets the global upper bounds for an array of variables.

        This method is a convenience wrapper for getGlobalUB(IloNumVar[],int,int). See the reference documentation of that method for further details.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if vars or any of its elements is null.
        Parameters:
        vars - The variables for which to query the global bounds.
        Returns:
        The global bounds for the variables in vars.
        See Also:
        getCandidatePoint(IloNumVar[],int,int)

      • getGlobalUB

      • addUserCuts

        public abstract void addUserCuts(IloRange[] cuts,
               int[] cutmanagement,
               boolean[] local)
                          throws IloException
        Adds user cuts.
        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arrays or any of its elements is null.
        Parameters:
        cuts - The cuts to be added.
        cutmanagement - An array with values from IloCplex.CutManagement, one for each cut.
        local - An array with Boolean flags (one for each cut) that indicate whether the cut is only locally valid.

      • addUserCut

        public void addUserCut(IloRange cut,
              int cutmanagement,
              boolean local)
                throws IloException
        Adds a user cut.

        This method is a convenience wrapper for addUserCuts(IloRange[],int[],boolean[]). See that method for further details.

        Throws:
        IloException - if an error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if cut is null.
        Parameters:
        cut - The cut to add.
        cutmanagement - A value from IloCplex.CutManagement that specifies how CPLEX should manage the cut.
        local - A Boolean value indicating whether this cut is locally or globally valid.
        See Also:
        addUserCuts(IloRange[],int[],boolean[])
